data.title: Tesla to raise price of 'full self-driving' option by $1,000 starting July 1
data.text: Tesla Inc. TSLA, +1.80% will raise the price of the "full self-driving" option on its electric vehicles worldwide by $1,000 starting July 1, Chief Executive Elon Musk tweeted late Monday.

data.title: Tesla Gets Permission to Ramp Back Up to Full Production in California
data.text: The electric-car maker's annual deliveries could see sharp growth in 2020 after all.

data.title: What are your thoughts on KM, WM and more #AskHalftime
data.text: The "Halftime Report" traders answer viewer question in #AskHalftime.

data.title: Tesla eyes Austin and Tulsa for Cybertruck production, report says
data.text: A new US Gigafactory will build the Cybertruck and provide space for more Model Y production.

data.title: Tesla reopening: Electric carmaker gets official OK from local government
data.text: Alameda County approved Tesla's health and safety plans to officially restart car production this week, according to the automaker.

data.title: Why China Loves Tesla
data.text: Despite being a California-based company, it's China where Tesla seems to have found its biggest fans.

data.title: Panasonic sees strong demand from Tesla, in talks to expand Nevada battery plant
data.text: Panasonic Corp's  finance chief said the company is seeing strong demand for battery cells from U.S. partner Tesla  and they are in talks to expand their joint plant in Nevada, which is now profitable.

data.title: Panasonic annual profit slides, but Tesla battery venture logs second quarterly gain
data.text: Japan's Panasonic Corp  posted on Monday a 29% drop in annual operating profit amid the coronavirus outbreak but said its battery cells joint venture with major customer Tesla Inc  logged a second straight quarterly profit.

data.title: Tesla Finally Receives County Approval To Restart Production At Fremont Factory, Week After Musk's Threats
data.text: Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ: TSLA) has received approval from Alameda County officials to restart production at its Fremont factory this week, the San Francisco Chronicle reported Sunday.
